question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

question.body:

3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?

question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will New York conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Oregon. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Oregon does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration is made, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition is not met.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Colorado hold a referendum on cannabis regulation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on cannabis regulation. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address cannabis regulation, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on cannabis does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue.
